results.title: Mr Blandings builds his dream house
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Norman Panama, Melvin Frank and H C Potter
results.brief_description: A farcical comedy starring Cary Grant as Jim Blandings, an advertising man with two precocious daughters and a loving wife (Myrna Loy). Frustrated by their cramped and chaotic New York apartment, the Blandings purchase a property in Connecticut, hoping to relocate their family to an idyllic country estate. When their vision of peace and tranquility is shattered by the news that the house should be demolished, they embark on a expensive and highly charged journey to build a new home. Narrated by their pessimistic lawyer-friend (Melvyn Douglas) who anticipates problems and consistently advises the couple against their extravagant dream. Screenplay by Norman Panama and Melvin Frank, based on the novel by Eric Hodgins. Cinematography by James Wong Howe.

results.title: Mr and Mrs Smith
results.brief_description: A Hitchcock movie with a difference, a romantic comedy. Successful New York couple David and Anne Smith live happily by mutually agreed rules, that is until their secrecy is shattered by a visit from the civil celebrant who married them some years earlier in Anne’s home town. He has arrived to tell them that due to a state boundary dispute at the time of their wedding, they are not legally married. Social conventions of the time require them to take up separate residences immediately as they reconsider whether they really wish to be married or whether their futures lie better apart.

results.title: Mr and Mrs Robin's family
results.brief_description: Shows a nesting family of robins from spring to autumn. Mrs Robin builds a nest of grass and twigs in a pine tree. Four eggs hatch out, and feeding the fledglings is a full-time job for the parents. Before winter finds them migrating south, the robins rear a second family. Suitable for primary level.

results.title: Mr and Mrs Bridge
results.creator_credit: Cineplex Odeon Films in association with Miramax, Ismail Merchant and James Ivory
results.brief_description: Naive, prudish, yet sweet and endearing, India Bridge (Joanna Woodward) devotes every waking moment to her family. She has no understanding of current affairs because that’s Walter’s (Paul Newman) domain - he knows everything and he’s never wrong. That’s Mr and Mrs. Bridge, or is it? As their children mature and discover boys, girls, sex and silliness, India and Walter suddenly face challenging issues. When Mrs. Bridge decides to show that she is more than a doormat, her new-found independence sparks a heartwarming journey for the whole family - from curious moments, to crisis after amusing crisis. Co-starring Blythe Danner, Simon Callow, Kyra Sedgwick, Robert Sean Leonard, Margaret Welsh, Austin Pendleton and Saundra McClain. Based on the novels “Mr Bridge” and “Mrs Bridge” by Evan S. Connell.

results.title: Mozzie [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Jane Keneally and Dylan Yeo
results.brief_description: As a man tries to sleep two animated mosquitoes buzz around him, attending to the business of blood sucking and fending off insect repellent in the process. A short film that effectively mixes live action with computer animation to convey the themes of global warming, the effect of chloro fluorocarbons and alternative therapy in brain surgery.

results.title: Mozart in motion: the masterworks process
results.creator_credit: Masterworks Workshop, Richard J. Hughes, Walt Witcover and Robert Vervoordt
results.brief_description: Shows the evolution of the performance of Act I, Scene 2 of Mozart’s ‘Don Giovanni’ by the actor-singers of Masterworks Laboratory Theatre.

results.title: Mozart in Delphi
results.creator_credit: Don Philps and Robert L Allnutt
results.brief_description: This is a film of a journey to the source of Western civilisation in the ruins of the historical site at Delphi. The music of the Classic Greeks has not survived but in the form and harmony of Mozart’s music the Apollonian concepts are given complete expression. In 1985, the Australian Chamber Orchestra travelled to Greece to perform in Athens and at Delphi as part of the Cultural Capital of Europe Festival 1985 to honour this classic heritage. Rated: G

results.title: Mozart and his music
results.brief_description: The film traces the development of Mozart’s music at different periods in his life by showing the people and places which probably influenced his music; the house in Salzburg where he was born; scenes in Rome, Milan and Naples where he was acclaimed a boy genius; and Vienna where he later lived and composed some of his most important works. Excerpts from the following are included in the film: the Overture to the “Marriage of Figaro”; the First, Second and Third Movements of the Piano Concerto No. 23; the “Requiem” from the Requiem Mass; the Overture and “Batti, batti” aria from “Don Giovanni”; and the Allegro Movement from the Piano Sonata in C. Major.

results.title: Moving wool
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Don Murray and Stanley Dalby
results.brief_description: Shows modern methods of wool handling, from shearing and grading, to baling and shipping. Technical advances have enabled improvements in wool processing. New ideas and approaches could lead to increased efficiency and quality in packaging and transportation of wool. Emphasises the importance of wool to Australia. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.
